alert.note: Alert for Early; Miller (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:08PM EDT until June 14 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT/745 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN HENRY COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN ALABAMA...WESTERN MILLER...SOUTHEASTERN CLAY...SOUTH CENTRAL RANDOLPH...WESTERN CALHOUN AND EARLY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 808 PM EDT/708 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Cuthbert to 8 miles northeast of Headland, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Blakely, Edison, Arlington, Columbia, Centerville, Jakin, Bellville, Haleburg, Bluffton, Saffold, Parksville, Carnegie, Hayes, Mayhaw, Rock Hill, Early Co A/p, Hentown, Suttons Corner, Hilton and Harrisons Mill. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT/1100 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
